intro: Calycorectes dominicanus, commonly known as the Dominican coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Dominican Republic. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, bright yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, typical of the genus. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry, open habitats. Calycorectes dominicanus is valued for its ornamental appeal and contributes to the biodiversity of its native ecosystem.
